summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and defense attorney Jill Greenfield, discussing preparations for a potential interview with a client (presumably a witness or victim) regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails include a list of proposed questions covering the client's background, relationship with Epstein and Maxwell, details of alleged sexual abuse, and knowledge of other victims.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Partner at Fieldfisher law firm, representing a client in discussions with the SDNY regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. She is coordinating a potential interview or proffer.

persons.name: Kyle Phillips
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the Southern District of New York, involved in the Epstein investigation. Corresponding with defense counsel to arrange an interview with a witness.

persons.name: Louise Scott
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the Southern District of New York, copied on correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation witness interview.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the SDNY investigation. The proposed questions seek information on how the witness met her, the nature of work for her, and her alleged involvement in sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and central subject of the investigation. The proposed questions seek details on the witness's relationship with him and allegations of sexual abuse.

connections.description: Defense attorney and federal prosecutor corresponding to arrange an interview with Greenfield's client regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys for the SDNY working together on the Epstein investigation correspondence.
Referred to together throughout the proposed questions as individuals the witness worked for and who allegedly engaged in sexual abuse.

Greenfield is stated to be in discussions with 'my client' in the context of providing information to the SDNY about Maxwell and Epstein. The client is likely a witness/victim associated with Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Call between SDNY and Defense
events.description: A call is scheduled between SDNY prosecutors (Phillips) and defense attorney Jill Greenfield to discuss her client's information regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Epstein Under Investigation
events.description: Referenced period when Jeffrey Epstein was under a prior investigation. The proposed questions ask if Epstein or Maxwell contacted the witness during this time.

events.title: New York Investigation
events.description: Referenced period of the SDNY investigation into Epstein and Maxwell. The proposed questions ask if either contacted the witness during this investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY jurisdiction)
keyFacts: SDNY prosecutors are actively seeking an 'attorney proffer' or summary from a witness represented by Jill Greenfield regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The proposed questions from the SDNY explicitly state it is their 'very general understanding' that 'abuse occurred' involving the witness.

The questions seek detailed information about the witness's first meeting with Epstein/Maxwell, the nature of work, specific tasks, travel, residence, and the dynamics of alleged sexual abuse, including Maxwell's direct involvement or presence.
Prosecutors are inquiring about the witness's knowledge of other underage girls subject to abuse by Epstein and/or Maxwell.
The correspondence shows a cooperative, preparatory phase between defense and prosecution ahead of a formal witness interview, with prosecutors emphasizing the witness's comfort level.
